title: Will we have more lore like the Confessions of the Broken Blade
body:
Because that was so exciting read and anticipate each part. I don’t even care who the characters are or what it’s about but more like that would be so nice.

~~PS a thriller in that form with Jhin, Shen, Zed would be mouth watering~~

replies.body: Do you mean serialised fiction? Or just longer stories in general?

Hello, thank you for responding to my thread. I mean more progression lore, especially if it takes place in the current time like the Confessions. I think serialized fiction would fit such a format better than a long story. Every part of Confessions hit the Reddit front page and was in the top 15 posts in the least even though there was no big reveal to accompany it so there was obviously some great interest for it. This makes it all the more impressive. 

Another reason (other than it being serialized progression) why it garnered so much interest was because it involved an interaction between Yasuo and Riven, two popular champions. So I think progression lore involving at least two champions than just one champion and an original character would be way more popular. Something Vi or Caitlyn investigating a crime in Piltover or maybe Lucian coming across Kalista in Shadow Isles. Or maybe some internal conflict with Talon and Katarina concerning Du Couteau.

>
> Do you mean serialised fiction? Or just longer stories in general?

Let's go for a penny horror like Carmilla. If you REALLY want to spice it up, have it be from the perspective of the killer. Except that killer isn't a champion in the game - yet. Pyke would have been beautiful for this. It would have led to a wonderful reveal.
Maybe non-cannon lore if Riot ever did a Jack The Ripper Pyke skin?

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=hTtxEaM4,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-10-02T00:03:44.935+0000)
>
> Do you mean serialised fiction? Or just longer stories in general?

Dug through the Red Tracker to find this and, yes, both.  It was exciting to read through the series.  Importantly, I want to see updates to lore in this form.  Stories that end where they began are boring.

The civil war arcs are the most important.  Shurima and the Freljord are in chaos, full of complicated relationships and heading for a dramatic change of government.  Personally, I hope that Ashe unites the Freljord and Taliyah inspires Shurimans to form a Republic after defeating Xerath and Renekton alongside Nasus, Sivir, and Azir.  Also Ashe and Tryndamereâ€™s marriage and Taliyah reuniting with her tribe for the warm and fuzzies. :3

Aside from the whole thing of the freak accident causing Yasuo's master to die rather than a more surprising twist I agree. That ending just disappointed me. The whole story was great until then. Although Riven seemed a lot too victim-like for my taste. I always thought of her as more of a strong willed good hearted warrior.

Please don't remind me, i absolutely hate anything that has Riven and Yasuo in the same story. 
I just wish there is some storyline where Riven murders Yas mercilessly without showing any emotions.

Also, when i first started league, i liked Riven and her story line, She rose through Noxus, proving her might and power. 
She was against using cheap tricks and weapons, which made her glorious (in some way), but after the war, the story went into this lame character that seems to be broken but not really, she is self conflicted and unsure of what she is and what she has done, Ignoring the whole Crimson Elite, her redemption story and the return to noxus. 


For Riot, please don't make Riven as lame and as pathetic as she seems to be currently,it went against everything she is, or she was. especially at the end of the broken blade.

redemption and crimson elite were never canon in the first place,they are just alternate universe skins.

Also what you are describing was always Rivens character arc.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenLore,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=hTtxEaM4,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-10-03T23:57:40.617+0000)
>
> redemption and crimson elite were never canon in the first place,they are just alternate universe skins.
> 
> Also what you are describing was always Rivens character arc.

No, that's not how she always has been. ]

There were a few lore updates, but the last one, was all about the terror of the battle and how she seeks to make Noxus great and pure (Strength is all that matters, and the glory of the battle)

This riven is nothing but a nobody who is running away from reality, meanwhile the old riven was self-exiled and on a quest to change Noxus. 

I knew that Crimson elite was non-canon but Redemption suits the story too well to be left out. 
Riven's playstyle and champion doesn't suit her lore, as a riven, you usually go all in, a lot of the times, you don't play at a safe distance and attack from range, which is not expressed in her new lore. 
I wouldn't mind some mind-shattering memories and a lot of battle scar, but i do think that she lost a good amount of her character in the latest lore update.

Now it is all "She is running away, Noxus will kill her, she is afraid of returning to Noxus, Ionia embraced her." 
And the whole "Shattering her sword caused the village's elder to die." 

Lame, just lame.

Let alone the Yasuo encounter. 
It is unspeakable, it is not even the same champion.

Also it cheapens riven's story that she was forgiven so easily. The same court put a bounty on yasuo's head without giving him a chance to explain things yet they hold a trial and forgive riven because...reasons? She didnt even seem like she wanted to make up for her deeds as all she did was weeping and wanting to die. Riven doesnt reforge herself, its ionia that points her on her path which makes riven as a character useless and uniteresting. This is not the riven people came to love

Not that I particularly like the direction Riven was taken, but an explanation as to why they would hold a trial for Riven and not Yasuo would be that there was some doubt as to whether or not Riven was guilty, whereas with Yasuo it seemed obvious and no one was doubtful. 

Honestly I would have much preferred it if Riven had actually killed the elder, but regretted it, rather than this whole "it was an accident" story. It just feels too convenient that it was an accident and she really should have had blood on her hands. Regardless, I think they can still make Riven an interesting character, if we ever get more progression.

You are right i think its just there was a comment from the judge in the story where she said to the peasents that they needed real evidence to judge.(when riven was brought in and  they were raging about how yasuo killed the elder). I found that ironic given how they already condemned yasuo back then

I agree that Riven should have killed the elder and later regret it with all the killings she has blindly done. That was the whole point of her character that she realised she was in the wrong and tried to find a way to mend things and follow her own path. She was presented as someone who would forge her own path but here she quite easily ended up chilling in ionia which is strange. I mean if she really feels ashamed and guilty how can she allow that old couple call her daughter? Shouldnt she keep them at a distance as she herself cant forgive herself? I feel riven was a complicated character who would have required several stories to solve but riot took a lazy way and deleted half her personality. 
She still may end up doing stuff but i dont think riot can bend her lore in a way that it wouldnt feel forced.
I hope so, I would kill for small character progressions like that.
